intro: Pseudolysimachion longifolium, commonly known as the long-leaved pseudolysimachion, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and compound leaves with elongated, lance-shaped leaflets. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is native to regions of southern Europe and western Asia, often found in grassy areas and rocky soils. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and natural habitats.
